meanings.definition: To surpass in number or skill
meanings.sent1: In the race, he managed to outman his competitors with his speed.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to outmaneuver her opponents in chess.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to outman the birds in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The clever fox was able to outman the hunters by using its cunning.
meanings.sent5: The superhero used his powers to outman the villains and save the city.

meanings.definition: A person who surpasses others in number or skill
meanings.sent1: He was known as the outman in the team for his exceptional skills.
meanings.sent2: The outman in the group always led the way during expeditions.
meanings.sent3: The outman at the office always finished tasks before anyone else.
meanings.sent4: She was the outman in the class when it came to solving math problems.
meanings.sent5: The outman of the village was respected by all for his wisdom and strength.
